intro: Trifolium rusbyi subsp. reflexum, commonly known as the reflexed clover, is a rare and specialized member of the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three oval-shaped leaflets with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in specific microhabitats, often in moist, shaded areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
